migration-guide.introduction: Convert Markdown docs into XML by mapping elements. Goal: structured, machine-readable, easy to process.

document-root.example: # My Title Lorem ipsum etc... = Lorem ipsum etc...

target-structure.headings: <1>Map H1-H6 to XML tags named after heading text</1> <2>Lowercase, replace spaces with underscores</2>

paragraphs.example:
This is some text. =
This is some text.

lists.example: 1. Step one = <1>Step one</1> 2) Step two = <2>Step two</2> # 3 Step three = <3>Step three</3> - Bullet example = <4>Bullet example</4> (automatically detected the order number)

target-structure.blockquote:
> Knowledge is power. =
Knowledge is power.

migration-guide.migration-plan: <1>Parse Markdown into AST</1> <2>Transform AST → XML structure</2> <3>Validate XML with XSD/DTD</3> <4>Post-process (XSLT, DB import, CMS integration)</4>
migration-guide.conclusion: Clear rules + migration plan → reusable, structured, machine-friendly docs.
